attributes.action: Students with compulsory placement year to progress into the final year
attributes.additional_details: Due to coronavirus students have suffered mentally with work obligations and financial struggles, students are now facing immense pressure of applying for a work placement as universities claimed that it is compulsory for sandwich degrees. And if not found then students are forced to take a gap year. Opportunities have become limited, it has become more competitive to find a placement as the majority have received rejections. The majority would like to progress onto their final year and graduate
attributes.background: Allow universities to give students the opportunity to dismiss the compulsory year of work placement and let them move onto their final year of studies

rejection.details: Decisions about university courses are a matter for individual universities, not the Government or House of Commons. Where courses lead to a professional qualification these will need to meet the standards required by the relevant professional body.
